### 1a. Source data
```{r source, warning = TRUE, results = FALSE, message = FALSE}

   library(tidyverse)
   library(janitor)
   library(tidytuesdayR)

   tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2019-12-17')
   dog_travel_raw <- tuesdata$dog_travel
```


#1b.  Source state information
```{r}

  states <- tibble (
      state_region = state.region,
      state_division = state.division, 
      state_abb = state.abb,
      state_name = state.name
      ) %>%
   arrange (state_region, state_division)
```


#1c.  Source fonts
```{r}

   library (showtext)
   
   font_add_google("Gaegu")
   showtext_auto() 
```


### 2.  Transform
```{r transform, warning = T, results = F, message = F}

   dog_travel <- dog_travel_raw %>%
      rename (
         current_state = contact_state,
         prior_state = found
         ) %>%
      mutate (
         prior_state = ifelse (is.na (manual), prior_state, manual),
         prior_state = case_when (
            prior_state == "VA" ~ "Virginia",
            prior_state == "MD" ~ "Maryland",
            prior_state == "NC" ~ "North Carolina",
            prior_state == "LA" ~ "Louisiana",
            prior_state == "Charlotte" ~ "North Carolina",
            prior_state == "NM" ~ "New Mexico",
            prior_state == "NJ" ~ "New Jersey",
            TRUE ~ prior_state)
         ) %>%
      inner_join (states, by = c("prior_state" = "state_name")) %>%
      inner_join (states, by = c("current_state" = "state_abb")) %>%
      filter (current_state %in% state_abb) %>%
      select (state_abb, state_region.x, current_state, state_region.y, id) %>%
      rename (
         prior_state = state_abb,
         prior_region = state_region.x,
         current_region = state_region.y
         ) %>%
      group_by(prior_region, current_region) %>%
         tally ()
```


### 3. Visualize
```{r visualize, message = F, warning = T}

   library(ggalluvial)
   library(viridis)

   ggplot(data = dog_travel, aes(axis1 = prior_region, axis2 = current_region, y = n)) +
      geom_alluvium(
         aes (fill = prior_region),
         alpha = 0.8, decreasing = F
         ) +
      geom_stratum(decreasing = F) +
      geom_text(stat = "stratum", infer.label = TRUE, size = 2, decreasing = F, family = "Gaegu") +
      scale_fill_viridis(discrete = T) +
      theme (
         plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0, size = 10, face = "bold", margin = margin (0,0,0,0)),
         plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0, size = 8, margin = margin (0,0,5,0)),
         plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0, size = 8, face = "plain", margin = margin (0,0,0,0)),
         panel.background = element_rect(fill= "white"),
         axis.text.x=element_blank(),
         axis.text=element_text(family = "Gaegu"),
         axis.ticks.x=element_blank(),
         legend.position = "none",
         text = element_text(family = "Gaegu", face = "bold")
         ) +
      labs(
         title = "Adoptable Dogs tend to have Southern roots",
         subtitle = "- Walkers and bikers to work tend to live in small towns in Northeast, Midwest and Pacific Coast.",
         y = "# of Adoptable Dogs",
         caption = "Left column is birth region of the dog.  Right column is the region dog is available for adoption.\nVisualization: Joel Soroos @soroosj  |  Data: The Pudding via R4DS Tidy Tuesday"
         ) +
      ggsave("dogs.png", width = 13, height = 10, units = "cm")
```
